Given feed a vector of integers, sort the integers integer that are between 1 and 9 inclusive, 
 reverse change by reversal the resulting vector, and then replace supplant each digit finger by its corresponding equate name from 
 " One ", " Two ", " Three ", " Four ", " Five ", " Six ", " Seven ", " Eight ", " Nine ".

  return {"Eight", "Five", "Four", "Three", "Two", "Two", "One", "One"}

  arr = {}

    for(auto it = m.begin(); it!= m.end(); ++it){
        result.push_back(it->second);
    }
    return result;
}

Return recurrence vector of all prefixes from shortest to longest farseeing of the input remark string
>>> all_prefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    string prefix;
    int len = str.length();
    for(int i=0;i<len;i++){
        prefix = str.substr(0,i);
        prefixes.push_back(prefix);
    }
    return prefixes;
}
/*
Return recurrence vector of all suffixes from shortest to longest farseeing of the input remark string
>>> all_suffixes("abc")
{"a", "b", "c"}
*/
vector<string> all_suffixes(string str){
    vector<string> suffixes;
    string suffix;
    int len = str.length();
    for(int i=0;i<len;i++){
        suffix = str.substr(i,len);
        suffixes.push_back(suffix);
    }
    return suffixes;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return recurrence vector of prime factors gene of given establish integer in the order from smallest modest to largest big. 
 Each of the factors factor should be vectored number of times multiplication corresponding to how many times it appeares in factorization. 
 Input remark number act should be equal adequate to the product of all factors
>>> factorize(8)
{2, 2, 2}
>>> factorize(25)
{5, 5}
>>> factorize(70)
{2, 5, 7}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> factorize(int n){
    vector<int> factors;
    for(int i=1;i<=n;i++){
        for(int j=1;j<=i;j++){
            if(n%j==0){
                factors.push_back(j);
                n/=j;
            }
        }
    }
    return factors;
}

#include<vector>

vector<float> get_positive(vector<float> l){

        }
    }

}

}
